newsitem.title: USA: Eagle Point sees Q4 loss bigger than estimates.
newsitem.headline: Eagle Point sees Q4 loss bigger than estimates.

text.p: Eagle Point Software Corp said Wednesday it expects to report a fiscal fourth quarter operating loss greater than analysts' estimates of $0.01 a share.
The company cited seasonally slower-than-anticipated sales, a deferral in a portion of the quarter's software revenues that were part of an upgrade promotion, and a continued softness in the market.
According to First Call, the consensus of analysts' estimates is a loss of $0.01 a share versus a profit of $0.08 a share for the quarter ended in June.

Eagle Point, which supplies software for civil engineers, architects and others, said operating results are historically lower during its fourth and first quarters, and the sales for the fourth quarter were lower than anticipated.
The softness in the market is related to delays in purchasing decisions because of a pending merger, recently released products and the anticipation of new technology.
On Wednesday, Eagle Point shares closed unchanged at 40-3/8.
